entries.already_being_sliced: That item is already being sliced.
entries.already_sliced: That item has already been sliced.
entries.armor_0: You have prepared several additions to the armor.  In order for the modifications to work, you'll need to modify the armor's balance and stabilizing systems to accept your changes.  The core systems seem to be protected by a simple Imperial-spec anti-tampering device.  Working carefully, you begin to disable the device.
entries.armor_1: You've managed to disable part of the anti-tampering device.  The designer of this armor did a good job, but you're better.  Removing the second flow regulator cable should give you access to the stabilization systems.
entries.armor_analyze_0: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the anti-tampering system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.armor_analyze_1: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the anti-tampering system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.armor_at_max: This piece of armor has already surpassed its maximum protective capacity and cannot be sliced.
entries.armor_clamp_0: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the anti-tampering device expansion leads.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.armor_clamp_1: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the anti-tampering device expansion leads.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights red, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.armor_examine: You have successfully removed part of the anti-tampering device.  Another precision cut and you should be able to integrate your upgrades into the armor's stabilization system.
entries.blue_cable: Cut the positive (blue) flow regulator cable.
entries.blue_cable_cut: The positive (blue) regulator cable is cut.
entries.broken: The locking mechanism appears to be broken.  You will not be able to open this device.
entries.container_0: You slide away a rear access panel revealing the power flow system.  If you can cut power to the locking mechanism, you should be able to open the container.  This model of container appears to have two power flow cables.
entries.container_1: You have cut one of the wires to the power system.  The backup locking mechanism hasn't clamped down...it looks like you chose wisely.
entries.container_analyze_0: You gently fuse the analyzer node to the power system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to locking mechanism.'
entries.container_analyze_1: You gently fuse the analyzer node to the power system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to locking mechanism.'
entries.container_clamp_0: You carefully install the molecular clamp on the power node.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.container_clamp_1: You carefully install the molecular clamp on the power node.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights red, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.container_examine: The cut is clean and the wires pose no danger of shorting the rest of the system.
entries.container_fail: An angry buzz sounds and a reinforced magnetic backup lock slides into place.  It doesn't look like anyone will be able to access this container.
entries.container_success: With a click the locking mechanism releases.
entries.dam_mod: You have successfully increased the damage range of the weapon by %DI%!
entries.eff_mod: You have successfully increased the base effectiveness of the armor by %DI%!
entries.enc_mod: You have successfully reduced the encumbrance of the armor by %DI%!
entries.fail_armor: You've made a critical mistake modifying the armor's basic systems.  The damage is extensive and while the armor still retains its previous effectiveness, no one will be able to modify it in the future.
entries.fail_weapon: You've made a critical mistake modifying the weapon's basic systems.  The damage is extensive and while the weapon still retains its previous effectiveness, no one will be able to modify it in the future.
entries.hq_security_0: You remove the terminal's rear access panel.  A jumbled mess of conduits and cables press toward you.  After rooting around for a bit, you find the flow regulator attached to the override security module.
entries.hq_security_1: The security subsystem is partially rerouted.  A little bit more work and you should be able to relax the override terminal's security protocol.
entries.hq_security_analyze_0: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the security subsystem.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to subsystem regulator.'
entries.hq_security_analyze_1: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the security subsystem.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to subsystem regulator.'
entries.hq_security_clamp_0: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the security subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.hq_security_clamp_1: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the security subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.hq_security_examine: No one should notice the damage at first glance and there is nothing to indicate you had any involvement with this.
entries.hq_security_fail: Unable to successfully slice the terminal, you realize that the only way to reset the terminal is to carefully repair what damage you have done.
entries.hq_security_success: You have managed to slice into the terminal.  The security protocol for the override terminal has been significantly relaxed.
entries.keypad_0: The panel hinges down to reveal several transistors and a pair of wires snaking through the machinery to the magnetic door lock.
entries.keypad_1: You cut one of the wires.  You seem to have selected the correct one as the locking mechanism didn't auto-disable itself.
entries.keypad_analyze_0: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the security system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.keypad_analyze_1: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the security system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.keypad_clamp_0: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the security subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.keypad_clamp_1: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the security subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights red, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.keypad_examine: No one should notice the damage at first glance and there is nothing to indicate you had any involvement with this.
entries.keypad_fail: Unable to successfully slice the keypad, you realize that the only way to reset it is to carefully repair what damage you have done.
entries.keypad_success: You have managed to slice the power from the magnetic locks.  The door is now open.
entries.locked: The container appears to be locked.
entries.no_armor_kit: You need an Armor Upgrade Kit in order to perform that action!
entries.no_clamp: You need to have a Molecular Clamp to perform that action.
entries.no_knife: You need a Precision Laser Knife to perform that action.
entries.no_node: You need to have a Flow Analyzer Node to perform that action.
entries.no_weapon_kit: You need a Weapon Upgrade Kit in order to perform that action!
entries.not_again: There isn't anything more you can do to the terminal.
entries.not_armor: This item has no protective qualities and cannot be sliced.
entries.not_yet: You will be able to hack the network again in %DI seconds.
entries.red_cable: Cut the negative (red) flow regulator cable.
entries.red_cable_cut: The negative (red) regulator cable is cut.
entries.slicing_underway: Someone is already slicing that device.
entries.spd_mod: You have successfully increased the attack speed of the weapon by %DI%!
entries.terminal_0: You remove the terminal's rear access panel.  A jumbled mess of conduits and cables press toward you.  After rooting around for a bit, you find the flow regulator attached to the reward subsystem.
entries.terminal_1: The reward subsystem is partially rerouted.  A little bit more work and you should be able to convince this thing to give you a higher payout.
entries.terminal_analyze_0: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the reward subsystem.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to subsystem regulator.'
entries.terminal_analyze_1: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the reward subsystem.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to subsystem regulator.'
entries.terminal_clamp_0: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the reward subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.terminal_clamp_1: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the reward subsystem regulator.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights red, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.terminal_examine: No one should notice the damage at first glance and there is nothing to indicate you had any involvement with this.
entries.terminal_fail: You were unable to slice into the terminal.
entries.terminal_success: You have managed to slice into the terminal.  Your next mission reward will be increased.
entries.title: Slicing
entries.use_clamp: Shunt the power node with a molecular clamp.
entries.used_clamp: A Molecular Clamp has been used up.
entries.used_knife: Your Precision Laser Knife has lost a charge.
entries.used_node: A Flow Analyzer Node has been used up.
entries.used_up_knife: Your Precision Laser Knife has been drained.
entries.weapon_0: You have managed to strengthen the substructure of the weapon and remove excess weight.  You will need to modify the weapon's stabilizer systems in order for it to function properly.  The core systems seem to be protected by a simple Imperial-spec anti-tampering device.  Working carefully, you begin to disable the device.
entries.weapon_1: You've managed to disable part of the anti-tampering device.  The designer of this weapon tried to be tricky, but he wasn't good enough.  Removing the second flow regulator cable should give you access to the stabilization systems.
entries.weapon_analyze_0: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the anti-tampering system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of positive power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.weapon_analyze_1: You carefully integrate the analyzer node into the anti-tampering system.  After a few seconds, a scratchy electronic voice in the node says 'Analysis Complete: High probability of negative power flow to anti-tampering device.'
entries.weapon_at_max: This weapon has already surpassed its maximum power output and cannot be sliced.
entries.weapon_clamp_0: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the anti-tampering device expansion leads.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights blue, indicating you must cut the positive power cable.
entries.weapon_clamp_1: You gently fuse the molecular clamp to the anti-tampering device expansion leads.  A small indicator light on the clamp lights red, indicating you must cut the negative power cable.
entries.weapon_examine: You have successfully removed part of the anti-tampering device.  Another precision cut and you should be able to integrate your upgrades into the weapon's stabilization system.
entries.weapon: Select the type of slice you would like to apply to this weapon.
entries.select_slice: Select a slice from the list below. Some slices may not be applied until the slice before them has been applied. (I.E., in order to apply a level 2 damage increase slice, you must first apply the level 1 damage increase slice.)
entries.slice_applied: You have successfully applied the slice: %TO
entries.already_applied: FFFFFFThis slice has already been applied.
entries.already_applied_sys: That slice has already been applied to the item.
entries.cant_apply_sys: You can't apply that slice until you apply '%TO'
entries.cost_too_high: You aren't able to successfully slice the item. It has already been too heavily modified.
entries.not_in_inv: The item you were attempting to slice is no longer in your inventory.
entries.crit_mod: You have successfully increased the base crit chance of the weapon by %DI%!
entries.failed_no_equip: The weapon has suffered a system failure from damaged slices. You need to have a smuggler repair the damage.
entries.cant_fix: You don't have sufficient skill to fix the damaged slices on that item.
entries.fix_successful: You have successfully repaired the damaged customizations.
entries.armor: Select the type of slice you would like to apply to this armor.
entries.acrit_mod: You have successfully increased the base critical absorb chance of the armor by %DI%!
entries.res_mod: You have successfully increased the resilience of the armor to %DI%!
entries.def_mod: You have successfully increased the chance of impact deflection on the armor by %DI%!
entries.ab_mod: You have successfully increased the armor break reduction of the armor by %DI%!
entries.missing_component: FF0000You are missing a required component.
entries.missing_comp: You are missing a required component: %TO!
entries.cant_apply_cost: FF0000The slice is too complex for the item.
entries.can_salvage: It looks like you could probably salvage this upgrade kit.
entries.jedi: You lack the knowledge on how to enhance a Jedi weapon.
entries.static: This item can not be altered by a Smuggler.
entries.no_skill: You do not have the correct skills to slice this item.
